133.heading: Blows.
133.title: "It's a Stunning Blow"
133.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Jake Hoople arrives and asks where the old parlor ornament (his brother) is; Martha tells him Amos is working.

134.heading: Blows.
134.title: "My Dream Is You" 8 p. in Today's Romance, no. 5
134.author: [No author]
notes: "I gave Neil Hunter all the love and trust I could ever feel! And in return, I received the bitterest blow a woman can know, the heart-breaking words, 'I don't love you anymore!'"

135.heading: Blows.
135.title: "Sandman Scores a Blow to Crime"
135.author: Larry Dean
135.appears_in: 6 p. in Justice League of America, no. 94 (Nov. 1971) ; reprinted from Adventure Comics, no. 40 (July 1939)
notes: Begins: Extra! Vivian Dale kidnaped by.
Distinctive title supplied by Gene Reed.

136.heading: Blows for Justice.
136.title: "The Young Allies Deal a Blow for Justice"
136.author: Stan Lee
136.series: Captain America and the Young Allies
136.appears_in: 2 p. text in Captain America Comics, no. 8 (Nov. 1941).
notes: The Young Allies are Bucky, Jeff, Knuckles and Whitewash (introduced).
Data from Lou Mougin and Tony R. Rose via Grand Comics Database Project.

137.title: "Blows of Laughter"
137.author: Kraz
137.appears_in: 2 p. in Dutch Treat (Princeton, Wis. : Kitchen Sink Enterprises, 1977).
notes: Erotic gag cartoons.

138.heading: Blows to Crime.
138.title: "The Tarantula Strikes"
138.author: Bert Christman (as Larry Dean), script and art
138.appears_in: 6 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 40 (July 1939) ; reprinted in Justice League of America, no. 94 (Nov. 1971) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
notes: Introduction of The Sandman (Wesley Dodd or Dodds), and villain The Tarantula (Crossart).
The Sandman wears an orange business suit through issue 43.
Begins: "Extra! Vivian Dale kidnaped by"
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.
The distinctive title "Sandman Scores a Blow to Crime"* was assigned by Gene Reed in earlier indexing.

139.title: The Blowtop
139.author: Alvin Schwartz.
notes: "The book that sparked the Beat Generation!"

141.heading: Blowtorch Operators.
141.title: "Five Hammer Taps on a Bulkhead"
141.author: Ed Moore
141.appears_in: 4 p. in New Heroic Comics, no. 49 (July 1948).
notes: Summary: Marcinkowski is a ship's burner (blowtorch operator) in a Brooklyn shipyard who rescues a trapped welder and is awarded a watch by the company.

142.heading: Blozis, Al.
142.title: "Human Howitzer : Al Blozis" 3 p. in True Comics, no. 48
142.author: [No author]
notes: Comic books, strips, etc. I. Al Blozis. k. Howitzers. k. Athletes. Call no.: PN6728.1.P3T7no.48

144.title: Blosser, Merrill, 1892-1983
notes: American comics artist, creator of Freckles and His Friends
